data.title: Grey Goo - A New RTS Game
data.meta_description:
Grey Goo  is  the next RTS game from Petroglyph Games. It's a throw back to the older Command & Conquer  games with a simplified building system. 

I'm glad...
data.text:
Couchpotato

Part-Time News-bot

Joined

October 1, 2010

Messages

37,618

Location

Spudlandia

March 13, 2014

#1

Grey Goo is the next RTS game from Petroglyph Games. It's a throw back to the older Command & Conquer games with a simplified building system.

I'm glad for them since after the cancellation of End of Nations the developer was in trouble. I hope this game doesn't share the same fate.

Five centuries after humans first left earth, three factions fight to control the lifeblood of a rocky oasis: Ecosystem Nine. It is a world of chaos. Survival depends on the ability to grow, fight—and to evolve.

As commander to one of three factions, your goal is simple: to wage war. To forge machines of battle from catalyst, Nine’s powerful resource—because whoever attains the largest supply has the tightest grip on the future.

Here are a few links.

PC Gamer preview- http://www.pcgamer.com/previews/grey-goo-preview/

Games Webpage- http://greygoo.greybox.com/

Thanks Couchpotato for posting about the game!

Your welcome I enjoyed playing most of the games made by Petroglyph. I'm glad to see another game follow the old school RTS mechanics of Command & Conquer.

Every RTS game developed now seems to follow Relic's Dawn of War games.

It's been a while since I posted anything about this game in my thread. The game developer Petroglyph posted a new Story Trailer, and Developer Diary.

The young Beta commander, Saruk, recounts the journey of his people from their first venture into the stars to their harsh existence on Ecosystem 9. This is the first Grey Goo video exploring the lore of the game's races and their fight for survival on the new world.

The Grey Goo team talks about getting back to the roots of RTS gaming in this latest dev diary!
